alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 19 at 3:04AM HST until April 19 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Oahu in Honolulu County * Until 600 AM HST. * At 258 AM HST, water levels in Waiahole Stream have risen to the point that flooding of Kamehameha Highway near Waiahole Valley Road is expected. Flooding in other nearby drainages is also likely. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Stream Gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waikane, Waiahole, Kahaluu, Ahuimanu, Kaaawa, Punaluu, Kaneohe, Kualoa, Kahana Valley State Park and Heeia. This warning may need to be extended beyond 600 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
